entry.title: Varroa destructor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Varroa destructor (example pictured), the Varroa mite, is an external parasitic mite that attacks and feeds on honey bees and is one of the most harmful honey-bee pests in the world?

entry.title: Marceli Godlewski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Father Marceli Godlewski, known for his pre-war anti-Semitic activities, helped save the lives of hundreds of Jews held in the Warsaw Ghetto during the German occupation of Poland?

entry.title: a forthcoming TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a reception was held for civic leaders of Mayagüez, Puerto Rico, to promote a forthcoming TV station that never launched?

entry.title: Mathias Nordvig (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the scholar Mathias Nordvig argues that Norse mythology contains many implicit references to Icelandic volcanoes?

entry.title: Beegum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when a state highway between Beegum and Peanut was vetoed, a newspaper accused their residents of lacking imagination?

entry.title: Raymond Bushland (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Raymond Bushland and Edward F. Knipling won the 1992 World Food Prize for developing the sterile insect technique which eliminated parasitic screw-worms from the United States?

entry.title: HMS Trent (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that HMS Trent helped keep the Dutch in port by sending bogus signals to a non-existent fleet?

entry.title: New Zealand florin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a design for the New Zealand florin was criticized as looking like a violently defecating kiwi?
